body_html:
If you're not using a nightly then we don't know if the bug's been fixed already or not (and bugfixes don't get backported to old versions). You can download a nightly build by following one of the links here <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/#installation>.
…
On Wed, May 24, 2017 at 1:42 PM, David J. Elkind ***@***.***> wrote: I'm not an engineer, but it doesn't seem to make a lot of sense to attempt to recreate an error from a nightly. For reproducibility, I think one would attempt to reconstruct the error from a stable version. But if I do build from a nightly, which nightly should I use? — You are receiving this because you were assigned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#9824 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtimxxjngCwsDlcpPlXY5kJ-Ob1IuV8ks5r9JY9gaJpZM4NXdhS> .
body_text:
If you're not using a nightly then we don't know if the bug's been fixed
already or not (and bugfixes don't get backported to old versions).

You can download a nightly build by following one of the links here
<https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/#installation>.
…
On Wed, May 24, 2017 at 1:42 PM, David J. Elkind ***@***.***> wrote:
 I'm not an engineer, but it doesn't seem to make a lot of sense to attempt
 to recreate an error from a nightly. For reproducibility, I think one would
 attempt to reconstruct the error from a stable version.

 But if I do build from a nightly, which nightly should I use?

 —

body:
If you're not using a nightly then we don't know if the bug's been fixed
already or not (and bugfixes don't get backported to old versions).

You can download a nightly build by following one of the links here
<https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/#installation>.

On Wed, May 24, 2017 at 1:42 PM, David J. Elkind <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> I'm not an engineer, but it doesn't seem to make a lot of sense to attempt
> to recreate an error from a nightly. For reproducibility, I think one would
> attempt to reconstruct the error from a stable version.
>
> But if I do build from a nightly, which nightly should I use?
>
> —
